p: Several alterations in DNA methylation associated with PD pathogenesis are described. For example, DNMT1 catalyzing DNA methylation is downregulated in the postmortem brain samples of PD patients [ 42]. Although disputable due to the insufficiency of direct evidence [ 43], those changes may be associated with alterations in the gene expression of Î±-synuclein and other genes implicated in PD development, ultimately causing abnormal protein aggregation [ 42].
